message.content:
{"id": "2345", "title": "Bug 2345[Editor Mgmt] Open with a different type of editor has no effect if file already open (1GEWMSQ)", "description": "Bug 2345[Editor Mgmt] Open with a different type of editor has no effect if file already open (1GEWMSQ)", "OB": "When a file that is already open in an editor is selected, and the user chooses to open it with a different type of editor using 'Open With...', the file should be reopened with the selected editor.", "EB": "Currently, when a file that is already open in an editor is selected, choosing 'Open With...' and selecting a different editor has no effect. The file remains open in the original editor.", "SR": "To reproduce the issue: 
1. Open a new basic project
2. Create a new file named 'test.xml'
3. When the editor used is the scripted resource editor example, select 'test.xml' in the Navigator
4. Choose 'Open With...' -> 'Default Text Editor'
Expected result: The file 'test.xml' should be opened in a new editor, as the editor type is different.
Actual result: Nothing happens, and the scripted resource editor example remains active. 

NOTES: Searching for an existing open file should also consider editor types."}

origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '2345', 'title': 'Bug 2345[Editor Mgmt] Open with a different type of editor has no effect if file already open (1GEWMSQ)', 'description': 'Bug 2345[Editor Mgmt] Open with a different type of editor has no effect if file already open (1GEWMSQ) ', 'OB': '', 'EB': '', 'SR': "Reproduce the steps in: 1GEWMOZ: ITPUI:WIN2000Scripted resource editor example opens on XML files by default new basic project new file test.xml the editor used is the scripted resource editor example, which totally ignores the XML file content select test.xml in Navigator choose Open With... / Default Text Editor nothing happens; it's reactivating the scripted resource editor exampleSearching for an existing open file should also consider editor types.It should open a new editor on the file, because the editor type is different.NOTES: "}
